$!You must tell DVLA if you suffer from Arnold-Chiari malformation.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form B1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D[Download 'B1 - Confidential medical questionnaire' (PDF, 306KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066652.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver & Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have Arnold-Chiari malformation - download the correct form to let them know
title: Arnold-Chiari malformation and driving
